context: <a0_0>Himachal<a0_0/> was one of the few states that had remained largely untouched by external customs, <b5_0>largely due to its difficult terrain<b5_0/>. With the <a1_0><b6_0>technological advancements<b6_0/><a1_0/> the state has changed very rapidly. <b7_0>It is a <a2_0>multireligional, multicultural as well as multilingual state<b7_0/> like other Indian states<a2_0/>. Some of the most commonly spoken languages includes <a3_0><b8_0>Hindi, Pahari, Dogri, Mandeali Kangri, Mandyali, Gojri and Kinnauri<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The caste communities residing in Himachal include the Khatri, Brahmins of the Hindu Faith and the Sikh Brahmin Caste Bhatra, Rajputs, Gujjars, Gaddis, Ghirth (choudhary), Kannets, Rathis and Kolis, Sood There are tribal populations in the state which mainly comprise <a4_0><b9_0>Kinnars, Pangawals, Sulehria, and Lahaulis<b9_0/><a4_0/>.The people Of Himachal Pradesh are very simple and live a traditional ´Pahari' lifestyle.
